intro: Haplophyllum linifolium var. sexovulatum, commonly known as the six-ovary haplophyllum, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its unique floral morphology, particularly the presence of six ovules in each ovary, which distinguishes it from other varieties of the species. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in whorls. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
